revised_title: Thermal and Magnetic Properties of Cerium Ethyl Sulfate: A Review
tldr: This article explores the thermal and magnetic properties of cerium ethyl sulfate, focusing on adiabatic demagnetization experiments. The study reveals the existence of an antiferromagnetic transition and provides insights into the interaction mechanisms between ions, such as electric quadrupole-quadrupole and dipole-dipole interactions. The findings contribute to a better understanding of cerium ethyl sulfate's behavior and potential applications in nuclear orientation work.
